definitions: become less drunk or intoxicated through time or action
make someone become serious, thoughtful, or less optimistic about something
examples: He needed coffee to sober up after the party
The cold shower helped her sober quickly yesterday
The accident statistics sobered the young drivers immediately
Reality of unemployment sobered his ambitious career plans

definitions: participate in social activities and interact with other people
train someone to behave in ways acceptable to society
examples: The students socialise in the cafeteria between classes
She prefers to socialise with colleagues after work
Parents socialise their children through consistent behavioral guidance
Schools help socialise young people into community values

definitions: participate in social activities and interact with other people
train someone to behave in ways acceptable to society
examples: The students socialize in the cafeteria between classes
She prefers to socialize with colleagues after work
Parents socialize their children through consistent behavioral guidance
Schools help socialize young people into community values

definitions: hit someone or something with great force using the fist
examples: He socked the punching bag with all his strength
The boxer socked his opponent right in the jaw

definitions: become or make something less hard or firm to touch
make something less severe, harsh, or critical in effect
become or make someone more gentle, sympathetic, or amenable
examples: The butter will soften at room temperature quickly
Heat softens the plastic for easier molding
The editor softened the harsh criticism before publication
Diplomats worked to soften the economic sanctions
Her expression softened when she saw the child
Years of experience had softened his rigid approach

definitions: make something dirty by staining or marking with earth or dirt
damage or tarnish someone's reputation or character through shameful actions
examples: The children soiled their clothes playing in the garden
Don't soil the carpet with your muddy boots
The scandal soiled his reputation beyond immediate repair
She refused to soil her hands with corruption

definitions: stay somewhere temporarily as a visitor or guest during travels
examples: The artist sojourned in Paris for three months
They sojourned at the mountain resort every summer

definitions: give comfort or consolation to someone in distress or sadness
examples: Music solaced her during the difficult recovery period
Friends tried to solace him after his loss

definitions: join metal pieces together using melted metal alloy as adhesive
examples: The technician soldered the circuit board components carefully
He soldered the copper pipes to prevent any leaks

definitions: continue working or trying despite difficulties, exhaustion, or opposition
examples: She soldiered on despite her injury and exhaustion
The team soldiered through the project's many setbacks

definitions: ask for or try to obtain something from someone formally
offer one's services or goods, especially persistently or inappropriately
examples: The charity solicited donations from local businesses
The committee solicited feedback from all department members
Street vendors solicited tourists near the popular attractions
The company was fined for soliciting customers illegally

definitions: become hard or solid through cooling or chemical process
make something stronger, more definite, or more unlikely to change
examples: The melted chocolate will solidify in the refrigerator
Lava solidifies into rock as it cools down
The merger solidified their position in the market
Recent victories solidified her leadership of the party

definitions: perform an activity, especially music or flying, without accompaniment or assistance
examples: The guitarist will solo during the bridge section
She soloed for the first time after twenty flying lessons

definitions: find an answer to a problem, puzzle, or difficult situation
examples: Scientists worked together to solve the complex equation
The detective solved the mystery after months of investigation

definitions: perform an acrobatic movement where the body rolls forward or backward
examples: The gymnast somersaulted perfectly on the balance beam
Children love to somersault on the soft grass

definitions: gently calm a person or their feelings through kindness or care
reduce pain, discomfort, or inflammation through gentle treatment or remedy
examples: The mother soothed her crying baby with lullabies
His calm voice soothed her anxiety about the surgery
The cool compress will soothe your sunburned skin
This cream soothes muscle aches and joint pain

definitions: soak up liquid using something absorbent like bread or cloth
examples: He sopped up the gravy with fresh bread
Use paper towels to sop the spilled milk

definitions: feel or express deep distress, sadness, or regret about something
examples: She sorrowed over the loss of her childhood home
The nation sorrowed for the victims of the tragedy

definitions: arrange things systematically in groups according to shared qualities
deal with and resolve a problem or difficult situation
examples: Please sort these documents by date and importance
The machine automatically sorts recyclables from regular waste
We need to sort this problem before it escalates
They finally sorted their differences after long discussions

definitions: produce or cause to produce a noise or musical tone
give a particular impression when heard or described
measure the depth of water using a weighted line or sonar
examples: The alarm sounded at exactly six this morning
She sounded the horn to warn other drivers
Your proposal sounds interesting and worth further discussion
He sounds tired when talking on the phone
The crew sounded the harbor before bringing in ships
Marine biologists sound ocean depths for research purposes

definitions: become acidic or fermented, especially of milk or food
become bad-tempered, unfriendly, or less pleasant in character
examples: The milk will sour if left outside the refrigerator
Hot weather caused the cream to sour quickly
Their relationship soured after the business dispute
His mood soured when he heard the news

definitions: obtain materials, components, or services from a particular supplier or origin
examples: The company sources its coffee beans from Colombia
We need to source these parts from reliable manufacturers

definitions: plant seeds by scattering them on or in the earth
cause something undesirable to develop or spread among people
examples: Farmers sow wheat in the early spring months
She sowed wildflower seeds throughout her entire garden
His rumors sowed discord among the team members
The propaganda sowed fear throughout the population

definitions: position things at regular intervals with gaps between them
examples: Space the plants eighteen inches apart for growth
The posts were spaced evenly along the fence line

definitions: move and work outside a spacecraft while in space wearing a spacesuit
examples: The astronauts will spacewalk to repair the solar panels
She spacewalked for six hours during the mission

definitions: dig or turn over earth using a spade gardening tool
examples: He spaded the garden bed before planting vegetables
Workers spaded the heavy clay soil all morning

definitions: send unwanted or inappropriate messages electronically to multiple recipients
examples: Hackers spammed thousands of email addresses with advertisements
Don't spam the forum with repetitive promotional posts

definitions: extend from one side to another of something
last or extend throughout a particular period of time
examples: The bridge spans the river at its narrowest point
Her arms couldn't span the giant tree trunk
His career spanned five decades of remarkable achievements
The empire spanned three centuries before its decline

definitions: practice boxing with light blows as training exercise
argue or dispute in a playful or competitive manner
examples: The boxers sparred for three rounds before lunch
She spars with her trainer every weekday morning
The politicians sparred over tax policy during debates
The siblings constantly spar but remain close friends

definitions: refrain from killing, harming, or destroying someone or something
give something you can manage without to someone else
examples: The judge spared him from the death penalty
Please spare the old oak tree during construction
Can you spare some change for the parking meter?
She couldn't spare any time for the meeting

definitions: emit small fiery particles or brief flashes of light
trigger or give rise to a reaction, feeling, or situation
examples: The wires sparked dangerously when they touched together
Flint stones spark when struck against steel
Her speech sparked nationwide protests against the policy
The discovery sparked interest in ancient civilizations

definitions: shine brightly with flashes of light from reflection
be vivacious, lively, and witty in conversation or performance
examples: Diamonds sparkled under the bright jewelry store lights
Fresh snow sparkled in the morning sunlight
She sparkled at the party with her humor
The comedian sparkled throughout his entire performance

definitions: have a brief petty quarrel or argument about something trivial
examples: The couple spatted over who forgot the anniversary
Neighbors spatted about the property line for years

definitions: produce or deposit eggs, especially of fish or amphibians
cause something to come into being or generate new instances
examples: Salmon spawn in the same rivers where they hatched
Frogs spawn thousands of eggs in shallow ponds
The successful movie spawned numerous sequels and merchandise
Social media spawned new forms of communication

definitions: say words aloud to convey information, opinions, or feelings
deliver a formal address or presentation to an audience
be able to communicate in a specified language
examples: Please speak clearly into the microphone for recording
She spoke softly to avoid waking the baby
The president will speak at the graduation ceremony
He spoke for an hour about climate change
She speaks five languages including Mandarin and Arabic
Do you speak French well enough to translate?

definitions: pierce or strike with a spear or sharp pointed object
examples: The hunter speared a fish in the shallow stream
She speared the olive with her cocktail pick

definitions: lead an attack, movement, or important undertaking as its driving force
examples: She spearheaded the campaign for educational reform nationwide
The company spearheaded innovation in renewable energy technology

definitions: concentrate on and become expert in a particular area or skill
examples: She specialises in pediatric surgery at the hospital
The firm specialises in international tax law

definitions: concentrate on and become expert in a particular area or skill
examples: She specializes in pediatric surgery at the hospital
The firm specializes in international tax law

definitions: identify and state something clearly and definitely in detail
examples: Please specify your dietary requirements when booking
The contract specifies payment terms and delivery dates

definitions: mark with small spots or particles of a substance
examples: Paint specked her clothes during the renovation work
Mud specked the car's windshield after the storm

definitions: mark or cover with a large number of small spots or patches
examples: Freckles speckled her nose and cheeks attractively
Stars speckled the clear night sky above us

definitions: form a theory or conjecture without firm evidence
invest in stocks or property hoping to profit from fluctuations
examples: Scientists speculate about life on other planets
Journalists speculated wildly about the minister's resignation
Investors speculated heavily in technology stocks last year
He speculated in real estate during the boom

definitions: move quickly at a rate faster than normal
cause something to move or happen more quickly
examples: The ambulance sped through the empty streets
Cars were speeding dangerously on the wet highway
This software speeds the processing of large files
Coffee speeds up your metabolism in the morning

definitions: write or name the letters that form a word in order
have something as a result or consequence
take turns with another person doing something
examples: Can you spell your last name for me?
The child learned to spell difficult words correctly
This decision spells disaster for the company
Rising costs spell trouble for small businesses
The nurses spelled each other during the night shift
We spelled the drivers on the long journey

definitions: pay out money in exchange for goods or services
use time doing a particular activity or in a place
use up energy or resources until exhausted
examples: She spends too much money on designer clothes
The government spent billions on infrastructure projects
We spent the summer traveling through Europe together
He spends hours practicing piano every single day
The storm had spent its fury by morning
She spent all her energy on the project

definitions: add spices or seasonings to food for flavor
make something more exciting, interesting, or lively
examples: She spiced the curry with cardamom and cinnamon
The chef spiced the dish perfectly for local tastes
Travel stories spiced up his presentation considerably
She spiced her wardrobe with colorful accessories

definitions: deliver a long or fast speech typically used for persuasion
examples: The salesman spieled about the product's amazing features
She spieled her practiced pitch to potential investors

definitions: increase sharply and suddenly in level or amount
add alcohol or drugs secretly to a drink
pierce or fasten with a sharp pointed object
examples: Oil prices spiked dramatically after the pipeline closure
Her fever spiked to dangerous levels last night
Someone spiked the punch at the party
The drink had been spiked with sleeping pills
He spiked the volleyball over the net forcefully
Workers spiked the rails to the wooden ties

definitions: cause or allow liquid to flow over the edge of its container
reveal confidential information unintentionally or indiscreetly
examples: She accidentally spilled coffee on her laptop keyboard
Water spilled from the overflowing bathtub onto floor
He finally spilled the secret about their engagement
The witness spilled everything to the investigators
